lines.gurmukhi: crn srin gur eyk pYfw jwie cl siqgur koit pYfw Awgy hoie lyq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Gur Ayk Paidaa Jaai Chala , Satigur Koti Paidaa Aagay Hoi Layt Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A disciple who walks one step towards Guru to take his refuge and goes to him with devotion and humility, Guru advances to receive him (devotee) by taking million steps.

lines.gurmukhi: eyk bwr siqgur mMqR ismrn mwqR ismrn qwih bwrMbwr gur hyq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ayk Baar Satigur Mantr Simaran Maatra , Simaran Taahi Baaranbaar Gur Hayt Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who unites with the Lord by remembering the incantation of the Guru even once, the True Guru remembers him millions of time.

lines.gurmukhi: BwvnI Bgiq Bwie kaufI AgRBwig rwKY qwih gur srb inDwn dwn dyq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaavanee Bhagati Bhaai Kaudee Agrabhaagi Raakhai , Taahi Gur Sarab Nidhaan Daan Dayt Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who makes an offering of even a shell before the True Guru with loving worship and faith, the True Guru blesses him with the countless treasures of invaluable wealth that is Naam.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur dieAw iniD mihmw AgwiD boiD nmo nmo nmo nmo nyq nyq nyq hY ]111]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Daiaa Nidhi Mahimaa Agaadhi Bodhi , Namo Namo Namo Namo Nayt Nayt Nayt Hai ?111?

Shabad OS B.translation: The True Guru is a repository of compassion that is beyond description and understanding. Therefore myriad salutations to Him because there is no one else like Him. (111)
